definition: structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: And their home, also resembling is boudoir beauty, see inaccessibly .
sentences.chinese: 而他們的家，也像是深閨美人，難得一見。

sentences.english: By rare we meant they are probably not ordinary clouds you get to witness everyday.
sentences.chinese: 我們所謂的難得一見是指非每天常見的雲。

sentences.english: This bit of her act is really a moment of puppeteering history.
sentences.chinese: 她的這段表演實在是木偶戲歷史上難得一見的一幕。

sentences.english: Rock is a rarity on an island of sand.
But stars are rarely seen in the haze of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 但是在北京的光暈裏星星難得一見。

sentences.english: Collection of creative and unusual coasters from around the world.
sentences.chinese: 彙集您難得一見的全世界最富創意的茶杯墊。

sentences.english: Welcome to P. Schuyler & Sons, dealers in the rare and beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎來到斯凱勒父子公司“難得一見”店鋪。

sentences.english: As we approached the summit we were vouchsafed a rare vision.
sentences.chinese: 快到山頂時，我們有幸看到了難得一見的景象。

sentences.english: Immigrant networks are a rare bright spark in the world economy.
sentences.chinese: 移民經濟是世界經濟中難得一見的亮點。

sentences.english: Kennedy was a rare and charismatic politician.
sentences.chinese: 甘乃迪是難得一見有魅力的政治家。

sentences.english: You may never have another chance to see it.
sentences.chinese: 機會難得，以後你可能就難得一見了。

sentences.english: This lush paradise is home to creatures barely known and thousands more that wait to be discovered.
sentences.chinese: 綠色家園中住着難得一見，或許多未爲人知的動物。

definition: to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
